projects.description: A JavaScript project that generates a random movie quote from an array of 10 quotes. Utilizing JavaScript's setInterval function, a new quote is automatically generated every 15 seconds.

A JavaScript project using data pagination and filtering techniques to display student data. The built-in search functionality allows the user to look for names. The application accepts partial matches and dynamically filters the data to only display names containing the search text. The number of pages also adjusts based on the number of student names that have matched the search.

A registration form for a fictional developer conference. The form uses JavaScript regular expressions to perform client-side data validation. A number of features are built-in for accessibility (for example: no mouse is required to complete the form). All form fields must be valid in order for the form to submit.

A word game application utilizing object-oriented JavaScript. The user is given a virtual keyboard and a random phrase. The user guesses letters that are in the phrase. If five letters are selected that are not part of the phrase, the game ends.

This project is a demo of the fetch API in standard JavaScript. It creates a group of 12 employee profile cards on the page with data from a random users endpoint. Upon click, a more detailed modal card appears with additional user information. A new group of 12 users are fetched from the endpoint upon page refresh.
